dhp321:1: One who is trained can be led through a crowd,

dhp322:4: but more excellent that those is one who is self-trained.
dhp323:1: For it is not by means of those vehicles
dhp323:2: that one goes in the direction one has never gone;
dhp323:3: where one who is self-trained, well-trained,
dhp323:4: can go by means of that training.

dhp326:1: In the past this mind would wander,
dhp326:2: going wherever it wished, wherever it desired, wherever it found pleasure.
dhp326:3: Today I will subdue it with a wise understanding of causality,
dhp326:4: like an elephant-trainer subduing a rampaging elephant.
dhp327:3: Lift yourself up from the harmful path,
dhp327:4: like an elephant lifting itself up from the mud.
dhp328:1: If you can get a prudent companion
dhp328:2: to travel with, a steadfast person who lives an excellent life,
dhp328:3: then leave behind all your problems
dhp328:4: and go with them, satisfied and mindful.
dhp329:1: If you can not get a prudent companion
dhp329:2: to travel with, a steadfast person who lives an excellent life,
dhp329:3: then like a king leaving behind a conquered realm,
dhp329:4: go alone, like an elephant in its wilderness habitat.
dhp330:1: It is best to go alone;
dhp330:2: there is no companionship with a fool.
dhp330:3: One who lives alone and does nothing harmful
dhp330:4: will be at ease, like an elephant in its wilderness habitat.
dhp331:1: It is pleasant to have companions when the need arises,
dhp331:2: it is pleasant to be content with whatever comes,
dhp331:3: it is pleasant to have merit when life comes to an end,
dhp331:4: it is pleasant to leave behind all suffering.
dhp332:1: It is pleasant to be a mother in this world,
dhp332:2: it is pleasant to be a father;
dhp332:3: it is pleasant to be a contemplative in this world,
dhp332:4: it is pleasant to be spiritual.
dhp333:1: It is pleasant to have virtue that lasts into old age,
dhp333:2: it is pleasant to have established faith,
dhp333:3: it is pleasant to have attained wisdom,
dhp333:4: it is pleasant to do no evil.
